review: I am very tech savy. However, the Chromecast product is not user friendly.  It requires that you search for and load the program every time you want to launch the program. It fails to interface with your wifi due to any number of security provisions you may have to protect your wifi, meaning if you delete your wifi security to allow Chromecast to function you are exposing your entire network.  The product lacks a decent user interface, and support is nonexistent. Stay away unless you want to waste your time and money.

review: I received and the set up was very simple, my TV had an open USB to charge it which is nice but.....the chromecast wasn't able to sync with my router. I reset my router, I reset the chromecast, I've tried to troubleshoot every way imaginable and it still will not sync. According to the supported/compatible routers on their site, the router I have isn't supported. My router is less than a year old and the cheapest router that is supported is $60 which is a hidden cost to consider.

review: Excellent streaming quality. Very responsive in general, with minor delays in pausing or stopping streaming.The chrome cast occasionally freezes with netflix but a quick restart of the app on the ipad usually does the trick.It would be nice if it had access to things like the photo and video app or did a screen share like the Apple TV, but that may be more Apples doing than Google.
author: Jamsheer Anklesaria

review: I thought about purchasing the Chromecast when it was first announced a few months ago, but ended up waiting and adding it to my Christmas list. And boy am I glad I did!Set up was a breeze and in under 10 minutes I was streaming from YouTube, listening to Pandora, and viewing content from my browser. The setup was incredibly straightforward and easy. I was a bit concerned that the device wouldn't work as seamlessly with my Apple devices, but I have yet to run into any issues. The only minor setback is I wish more of my apps had Chromecast support from within the app, but that will come with time, I'm sure.Thanks to some clever people on the internet, there appear to be some great workarounds to stream any content from my computer that isn't expressly supported by Chromecast (like iTunes and VLC).I HIGHLY recommend this device to anyone looking for a more affordable alternative to Apple TV or wanting to "upgrade" their television to a smart tv.
